title: Minswap TypeScript SDK
description: Minswap is one of the leading DEXs on Cardano. Other applications need an easy way to integrate Minswap for swapping tokens.

f6_assessments.q0: The problems statement seems a little overconfident. Claiming to be one of the leading DEX's and that everyone needs to be able to connect to you when the app has only demo'd in testnet (and is currently down)? I guess voters can decide if the developer ecosystem really needs a typescript SDK to connect to it. This is as much about the proposers project as the developer ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have a plan to deliver an SDK to their platform. There is not reason to think they will fail to deliver. Its in their interest for their DEX.
f6_assessments.q2: There proposers have a clear plan with deliverables that is easy to audit. Obviously success of this proposal really depends on success of Minswap as a DEX. They have ambitious goals and success will be able to be judged against these goals.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is full of misinformation. Their SDK assumes the specific format of DEX data under the hood. It's not something that other teams will be easily able to adapt.
f6_assessments.q1: They have some code open source, but to be honest they seem junior and I am sure that such critical things should be built teams with that track record.
f6_assessments.q2: Good information is provided, but it's not a generic library that can be reused by other DEXes, as they'd have to use the same model in the backend as Minswap. Minswap model is just a clone of Uniswap, which we clearly know doesn't work on Cardano. Further, having this open sourced means that we'll have more scam projects. FInally, they've already written it, they just ask now for money for it.

f6_assessments.q0: The availability of a readymade Software Development Kit(SDK) will accelerate the development and deployment of Decentralised Exchanges, which can be used to swap tokens. Minswap has fielded a test net and claims to have a solution for scaling the number of operations. The availability of SDK has a critical role in the speed of growth of the Cardano Eco system.
f6_assessments.q1: Minswap has fielded test net and had conducted scaling test. They had demonstrated capability in the field. The team consists of nine coders as per the website which is likely to be sufficient to complete the proposal. The team has also been able to publish clear documentation and has a working demo. WIth these established facts in place, it is likely that the proposal will be completed successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The cost of the project is for two developers (blockchain and front end) for three months at the rate of 50UDS per hour. The rate is reasonable. The project has been divided into clear achievable tasks. The timelines look realistic. The resource generated will be available for the entire community. Therefore the project is clearly auditable and success can be measured accurately.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge asks how we can make the developer experience within the Cardano ecosystem better. This proposal aims to make a Typescript SDK for one of the leading DEXes in the Cardano ecosystem. Being an engineer myself I understand the value of have high quality libraries and SDKs. 

The problem statement clearly articulates how other players in the cardano ecosystem will want an easy way to add swapping to their app and the proposed solution clearly articulates that a Minswap Typescript SDK can fill the need. 

The roadmap is clearly defined with 3, 6 and 12 month milestones going from a beta to (hopefully) wide scale adoption. 

The solution will be very scalable since it will simply be a library/SDK that can be distributed through traditional means. The underlying infrastructure is also all decentralized which is a positive signal for the scalability of this proposal. 

I give this proposal a score of 5 for impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The single most salient point regarding the feasibility of this proposal is the fact that this team has already developed a working DEX. Being an engineer myself I know that building core infra like a DEX is much harder than building a Typescript library/SDK. 

That being said, it would be nice to get links to the LinkedIn profiles of the propersers. It's possible to find the github profiles by going to the "Team" section of minswap.org but it would be great if that info was presented in this proposal directly.

Another not clearly articulated aspect of this proposal (though it's possible to infer) is whether the proposal will need future funding. There are 3, 6 and 12 month milestones but the funding is a request for 3 months of work for 2 engineers. It would be great if the proposal could be more clear about this. 

Being an engineer myself, I have a hard time understanding why building this Typescript library/SDK needs the full time attention of a blockchain engineer. I do wish the proposal elaborated more on the technical details of what will be built.

Because of the lack of clarity on some of the aspects of the execution of the proposal I give this a score of 4 for feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
The ultimate metric by which this proposal can be measured is "has a typescript SDK for minswap been released?". This question should be fairly easy to answer. I think the milestones for the proposal are also well laid out and lend themselves to auditing. We, as a community, can figure out if a beta was released as open-source software within 3 months We can also figure out if v1 with high quality documentation is released by month 6 and we can similarly figure out if the SDK is used by most applications. However, the last point is a bit tricker because it's hard to figure out how many applications there are in the ecosystem.

Overall, I do wish there were more numeric metrics like "by month 6 we expect to have 500 swaps happen through the SDK". Have a numeric metric clearly defines success/failure. 

I give this proposal a score of 4 for auditability because it has good metrics for success but is missing numeric metrics.

f6_assessments.q0:
183 / 5000
Kết quả dịch
You guys have built Minswap decentralized exchange and are proposing to build Minswap TypeScript SDK this helps the project develop better, what are the additional challenges in this challenge?
f6_assessments.q1: Timeline resources and budget are adequate. Need to supplement detailed documents to better explain the implementation content and highlights than other projects
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap for the parts to be implemented, but more specific details are needed

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is perfectly suited for this challenge and clearly articulates key points of the challenge brief, such as identifying a current gap in the Cardano developer ecosystem, proposing options to close the gap, and a suit of products/tools to be developed. The accessibility and interconnectedness offered by the SDK will improve the ability of all developers to use Cardano by facilitating the integration of miniswap service across a variety of dApps and websites.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers provide ample evidence to show that the proposal will be implemented successfully if funded. Their DEX demo on their YouTube channel makes it clear that the team is equipped to deliver and has provided a substantial amount of work, and is ready to go live as soon as mainnet launches. Since services like Miniswap will be invaluable to the ecosystem as it develops, the SDK takes it further and makes Miniswap integration available to all developers. The proposers also provide a good budget for the work outlined. I appreciate them showing the going rate per hour which is easier for voters to understand than a lump sum for the amount of work. One question I think the proposers could answer is why they only have the hiring of engineers for 3 months but the project is predicted to take ~1 year to complete. All in all though, great proposal and a seemingly great addition to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: There is sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal. Given that this proposal is a sequel to the Miniswap DEX which was successful in fund 5, the team has showcased it ability to deliver. In addition, the milestones and final product are measured in a way that is easy for voters to follow. For example, the team lays out clear markers for what is to be accomplished at what stage and that the final product should be used by most applications and wallets as a way to swap native Cardano tokens. At each stage, the proposers could provide a brief update on where they are at and identify any challenges that have arose. Moreover, since the launch date is Dec 20th, there is a clear deadline for the work to be completed that also can be measured against. Great work and look forward to the next phase.

solution: Minswap SDK can be easily integrated in the frontend to embed a custom swap interface or construct an Alonzo swap transaction.
experience: Minswap has leading experience in integrating Alonzo smart contracts in the frontend. We have a fully integrated testnet to be released.
